TopicTitle: Tips and tricks you found out yourself

Articles.Content:
When holding on to a ladder, you can press shift+W/A/S/D and the kerbal will look in that direction.

For example, if you're on a ladder and hold shift+D, the kerbal will look to the right, and if you press space while doing so, he'll jump in that direction!

It took me more than you would think to discover it.

That's amazing, I had no idea!

Yeah that one is awesome.

I was also blown away by 'hold shift to run on EVA'. Though I have Sirine's sig to thank for that. I played probably 2 months before I learned it and at one point walked Jeb 22km to a rescue ship across Minmus.

Always look for a gravity assist if you have a gut feeling you are going to run out of fuel before you can complete a direct transfer (this is how I have been getting around the whole Joolian system in Alternis with only about 1 km/s of delta-v).

Building NASA-style space shuttles the easy way

1. In SPH, select a part you want as a "dummy". It should be the fuel tank you'll be using in your lifter.

2. (opt.) Add a radial decoupler on top.

3. Add the fuselage part that will be attached to the booster, then build the shuttle. Cockpit, wings, landing gear, everything that goes.

4. Save the shuttle as a subassembly.

5. Build the booster stage in VAB, add a decoupler, attach the saved subassembly, secure it with struts.

6. Profit. Or explode.

On all atmosphereless bodies other than Tylo, you should do your ascent like this: Give yourself some upwards velocity, and then do the gravity turn instantly, within a hundred meters of taking off. You should also flip your ship over to parallel with the ground the instant you have enough upwards velocity to not hit a mountain.

and, to rendezvous with another ship it's easier to start ahead of your target than behind it.

While holding a key to make a Kerbal walk, if you alt-tab out of the game without letting up on the key, he will just keep walking, even if you alt-tab back into the game. The problem is that the only way to get him to stop again is to hold the opposite walk direction key, then return to KSC. Still, useful for covering long distances in circumstances such as hiking to a rescue ship.

Putting Nukes on the quadcouplers and activating them seems to have their sheilds destroy the others, right?

Before you activate them, quicksave. Then activate them, they should all have their sheilds blow off and break all the other engines. F-9 back to last quicksave. Your ship will appear with no sheilds, and you can activate the nukes with no explosions. Took a while to figure this out.
